area: Urban Mobility Planning and Traffic Congestion Analysis
context_of_use: The use case occurs when an urban mobility planner is evaluating or monitoring traffic measures within the urban mobility planning system and requires automated insights about congestion caused by those measures, including optional suggested mitigation solutions.
scope: Urban Mobility Planning Decision Support System
stakeholders_and_interests: Urban mobility planner: Wants to be promptly informed when a traffic measure leads to congestion to avoid overlooking negative impacts and to obtain inspiration for possible solutions.
City administration: Wants proposed measures to avoid unacceptable congestion and to be supported by well-founded analysis.
Citizens and commuters: Want acceptable travel times and minimized congestion caused by implemented mobility measures.
Environmental stakeholders: Want congestion-induced emissions to be minimized when measures are planned or evaluated.
Emergency services: Want congestion to be controlled so that emergency response routes remain reliable.
description: This use case describes how an urban mobility planner receives congestion-related insights from the system when traffic measures are evaluated or monitored. The system notifies the planner if a measure leads to congestion and, in the same interaction, can provide suggested congestion mitigation solutions intended to inspire the planner in addressing the identified congestion.
triggering_event: The urban mobility planner initiates a request to review congestion impacts of a traffic measure or scenario within the system.
preconditions: The urban mobility planner is authenticated and authorized to use the urban mobility planning system.
The traffic measure or scenario to be evaluated is defined and available within the system.
Relevant traffic data required for congestion analysis is available to the system.
The congestion analysis engine is operational and able to process the selected measure or scenario.
postconditions: The system has presented the planner with information indicating whether the evaluated measure or scenario leads to congestion and, if congestion is detected, the characteristics of that congestion.
If congestion is detected, the system has provided the planner with suggested congestion mitigation solutions intended to inspire potential countermeasures.
The congestion insight results and any associated suggestions are stored in the system and remain accessible for later consultation by the planner.
assumptions: It is assumed that a "measure" refers to any traffic management or urban mobility intervention represented as a configuration or scenario within the system, such as speed limit changes, reversible lanes, adaptive traffic lights, closures of roads, or simulated events.

It is assumed that the system is capable of determining whether a given measure or scenario leads to congestion based on internal congestion detection logic and available traffic data; the details of this detection logic are outside the scope of this use case.

It is assumed that the notification to the urban mobility planner is delivered within the user interface of the urban mobility planning system as an on-screen alert or message and does not require external communication channels such as email or SMS.

It is assumed that suggested congestion mitigation solutions are generated by the system from preconfigured rules, models, or knowledge bases and that the suggestions are advisory in nature and do not result in automatic changes to the underlying measures.

It is assumed that the urban mobility planner explicitly requests congestion insights for a specific measure or scenario instead of the system running congestion evaluations continuously and autonomously in the background.

It is assumed that the referenced related use case "report measure impacts" is a separate use case that can optionally be extended with congestion insights, but this use case focuses only on the direct interaction where the planner receives congestion notifications and suggested solutions.

It is assumed that the system time to compute congestion insights, while potentially noticeable, is acceptable to the planner for interactive use and that very long-running batch computations are not required for the core flow.

It is assumed that all supporting actors such as "Urban Traffic Data Source" and "Congestion Analysis Engine" are internal or externally integrated components that operate automatically without requiring additional user interaction.
requirements_met: The system shall notify the urban mobility planner if an evaluated measure or scenario leads to congestion so that the planner does not overlook the congestion.
The system shall determine, for a selected measure or scenario, whether the measure or scenario causes congestion based on available traffic data and internal congestion detection logic.

The system shall present to the urban mobility planner, for a selected measure or scenario, the congestion status together with key characteristics of the detected congestion, such as severity indicators or affected areas, at a level of detail sufficient for planning purposes.

The system shall provide the urban mobility planner with suggested solutions for a traffic congestion associated with the evaluated measure or scenario so that the planner can be inspired to solve the problem.
The system shall allow the urban mobility planner to explicitly request congestion insights for a specific measure or scenario through the user interface.
The system shall record or make available the congestion insight results and suggested solutions for later review by the urban mobility planner within the planning system.
outstanding_issues: The exact quantitative thresholds and criteria that define when a measure "leads to congestion" are not specified and must be agreed with domain experts.
The required level of detail and types of metrics to be included in the congestion notification (e.g., average delay, queue length, travel time increase, affected links) are not specified.
The source, methodology, and update cycle for traffic data used by the congestion analysis engine are not defined.
The expected response time for delivering congestion insights to the planner after a request is initiated remains unspecified.
The acceptable level of automation and transparency for generating suggested congestion mitigation solutions, including how explanations or rationales should be shown, is not defined.
The degree of integration between this use case and the separate "report measure impacts" use case, including how congestion insights are embedded into reports, requires further clarification.
main_flow: 1. Urban mobility planner selects an existing traffic measure or scenario for evaluation within the system interface and requests congestion insights for that measure or scenario → System acknowledges the request and displays the selected measure or scenario context for confirmation.

2. Urban mobility planner confirms the selected measure or scenario and initiates the congestion analysis command → System validates that all required traffic data and configuration parameters for the selected measure or scenario are available and ready for analysis.

3. Urban mobility planner waits while the system performs the requested analysis → System invokes the congestion analysis engine to evaluate whether the selected measure or scenario leads to congestion based on available traffic data.

4. Urban mobility planner remains in the congestion insights view → System completes the congestion analysis and determines the congestion status and key characteristics for the selected measure or scenario.

5. Urban mobility planner views the displayed congestion status → System presents a clear notification indicating whether the evaluated measure or scenario leads to congestion, including summarized congestion indicators where applicable.

6. Urban mobility planner reviews additional details about the congestion for the evaluated measure or scenario → System displays detailed congestion information associated with the measure or scenario, such as relative severity indicators and affected network portions, in accordance with the system's configured metrics.

7. Urban mobility planner requests suggested congestion mitigation solutions for the detected congestion within the same congestion insights interface → System generates, retrieves, or selects suggested congestion mitigation solutions relevant to the detected congestion pattern for the evaluated measure or scenario.

8. Urban mobility planner examines the suggested congestion mitigation solutions → System presents the suggested congestion mitigation solutions together with descriptive labels sufficient to inspire the planner in addressing the identified congestion.

9. Urban mobility planner optionally decides to retain the congestion insights and suggestions for future reference and concludes the session → System stores the generated congestion insight results and any associated suggested solutions so that they remain accessible for later consultation and confirms successful completion of the congestion insights request.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): Planner changes selected measure or scenario before analysis. Condition: After viewing the selected measure or scenario for confirmation, the urban mobility planner decides that a different measure or scenario should be evaluated. The planner cancels the current confirmation, selects a different measure or scenario, and re-initiates the congestion insights request. The system updates the context to the newly selected measure or scenario and returns to Step 2 for confirmation and subsequent analysis.

AF-2 (from Step 5): No congestion detected but insights still required. Condition: The congestion analysis completes and the system determines that the evaluated measure or scenario does not lead to congestion according to configured criteria. The system displays a notification indicating that no congestion has been detected for the evaluated measure or scenario and may show baseline traffic indicators. The planner reviews the notification and may still document that the measure is acceptable from a congestion perspective. The flow then continues at Step 9 with storage and confirmation of the congestion insights without any suggested congestion mitigation solutions.

AF-3 (from Step 6): Use case extends "report measure impacts". Condition: The urban mobility planner is concurrently preparing or updating a measure impact report using the separate "report measure impacts" use case and wants to include the latest congestion insights. From within the reporting context, the planner invokes the congestion insights function for the relevant measure or scenario. The system executes Steps 2 through 6 of this use case to determine and display the congestion status and details, and then returns the summarized congestion results to the reporting context. The reporting use case continues by incorporating the congestion insights into the measure impact report and then resumes its own main flow without mandating Steps 7 to 9 of this use case.

AF-4 (from Step 7): Planner skips requesting suggested solutions. Condition: The urban mobility planner only needs to know whether the measure leads to congestion and does not require suggested mitigation solutions. After reviewing the congestion status and detailed information at Steps 5 and 6, the planner does not request suggested solutions. The flow proceeds directly to Step 9, where the system stores the congestion insights and confirms successful completion.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): Required data for congestion analysis is unavailable. Condition: When validating the selected measure or scenario, the system detects that mandatory traffic data or configuration parameters required for congestion analysis are missing or inaccessible. The system informs the urban mobility planner that the congestion analysis cannot be performed due to unavailable data and provides a message indicating which data categories are missing at a high level. The use case terminates without performing congestion analysis, and no congestion insights are stored for this request.

EF-2 (from Step 3): Internal failure in congestion analysis engine. Condition: While executing the congestion analysis, the congestion analysis engine encounters an unexpected error or becomes unavailable. The system logs the error condition and informs the urban mobility planner that the congestion insights could not be generated due to an internal analysis failure. The system does not present congestion results or suggested solutions for this attempt and the use case ends after the error notification.

EF-3 (from Step 7): Suggested solutions cannot be generated. Condition: After the planner requests suggested congestion mitigation solutions, the system fails to generate or retrieve applicable suggestions due to missing configuration, lack of suitable solution patterns, or internal errors limited to the suggestion component. The system informs the urban mobility planner that no suggested congestion mitigation solutions are currently available while keeping the previously displayed congestion insights intact. The flow then continues with Step 9, where the system stores the congestion insights without any associated suggestions and confirms completion.
information_for_steps: 1. Selected measure or scenario identifier, measure description, scenario configuration reference.
2. Measure or scenario configuration parameters, required data availability indicators, user authorization context.
3. Traffic volume data, network topology data, signal timing data, measure-specific configuration data submitted to the congestion analysis engine.
4. Congestion analysis intermediate results, computed congestion status flags, performance metrics internal to the congestion analysis engine.
5. Congestion status indicator (e.g., congestion present or not), summarized congestion metrics, affected area summary reference.
6. Detailed congestion indicators, such as severity levels per link or area, temporal distribution of congestion, and comparative baseline metrics as supported by the system.
7. Input describing detected congestion pattern, rule or model selection parameters for suggested solutions, candidate mitigation solution templates.
8. Suggested congestion mitigation solution list, each with label, high-level description, and relevance indication to the detected congestion pattern.

9. Persisted congestion insights record identifier, timestamp of analysis completion, association between measure or scenario and stored congestion results, association between measure or scenario and any stored suggested solutions.
